content: Career Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Oct 2018How do I go about starting a part-time career in building websites?I'm currently a CS undergrad and I like doing front-end designs for websites. How do I go about making a part-time career out of it while studying? What are the platforms would you recommend for me to start getting projects? What are the resources do you think I would have to read up like learning SEO Optimization?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jennifer FranslayLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Fiverr works in finding gigs for web design. Do note that while they are known for '$5 gigs', these days many of the gigs, especially time consuming ones go for way more than $5. All the best!2 comments1

Kenneth Lou15 Oct 2018Lol hey Jen! Do you currently do any part time web design gigs?Jennifer Franslay15 Oct 2018Aye! Not currently, but I used to for abit before uni! Got lucky with those bc the companies I was sharing an office with needed help with creating a website. Did it foc at first out of generosity but after that they ended up approaching me several more times for paid stuff haha.

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered on 14 Oct 2018The quickest way to get gigs is to work with a startup front end developer/digital marketer/copywriter. If they're actively looking for work, they could use you as a value proposition to get custom built websites at a lower cost. 0 comments1
